Review.Titre: Incredible dissatified with time to build and delays for in stock items
Review.Contenu: I placed the order February 18th, for a rig in which no parts were listed as Out of Stock, Unavailable, or anything. By the 21st, I had already received a message about a delay. And again, and again. On Sunday, March 5th I opened a complaint with Customer Service. This was now 2+ weeks from the time I ordered, and during the order process the expected shipping date was 2/28. The service rep apologized and said it would ship out on Tuesday. An entire week went by after this conversation before it was shipped. The lack of clear expectations in the beginning, multiple times being during "part selection" or whatever for what should have been in-stock items, and the overall lack of urgency on CLX's part as a whole, has left me very dissatisfied with the entire ordering and customer service process. There are lots of companies out there who put together other people's parts. I trusted you because the website gave me an indication that everything was in stock and I would have a ~10 day build time, not a MONTH.

Granted after picking a build I did ask to swap out parts for upgraded parts I had no problem in paying for upgrades immediately so this review is as in depth as I can get. Customer service was good. the overall experience subpar at best don’t be fooled by the live stream your PC is built in an assembly warehouse by noobs. you do not get the courtesy of decent plugs and cable management after spending just under 6k.the pc itself was ok trust me when I say of all builds I’ve seen there’s nothing that’s quality here. They succeeded as parts integrators as you can train monkeys to do the same. that’s it, If you’re a person that is detail oriented or OCD of things you have RUN AWAY. Even The Bios was outdated which wasn’t even surprising. Brad and Timothy provided good customer service which is the only thing that warranted at least 1 star. Other than that PLEASE spend your money elsewhere. All the hype is like all the crap out there today smoke and mirrors. Quality over quantity will always be better. Would not even recommend to an enemy let alone a decent human.

Avoid CLX Gaming (Cybertron). You can build a better PC for less money and less trouble. My experience with CLX Gaming has been one of the worst experiences with a computer company I have had. I decided to buy a custom high performance prebuilt system ($3800) because at the time I saw it as the easiest option. Shortly after receiving it, I noticed flickering graphics where it would flash frames of what had been previously displayed in games like Fortnite. The system would also randomly crash to a black screen with artifacts and restart itself. I spent months dealing with support via email with no improvement.  After months of back and forth, I was offered a full refund in writing, which I promptly accepted and was then told that the refund could not be fulfilled due to warranty even though it was clear how long the ticket had been ongoing when the offer was made. I have now filed a dispute claim with the credit card company and I am considering pursuing legal action.  Below is a summary of key points from my email thread with CLX.  Item: Prebuilt Computer - Assembled by CLX Gaming Processor: 12th Gen Intel(R) Core(TM) i9-12900KF @ 3.19 GHz GPU: NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3080 10GB Memory: 64.0 GB RAM OS: Windows 11 ⦁	Jan 29, 2022 - Order placed and paid for. ⦁	February 22, 2022 - Received via UPS. ⦁	February 24 - July 21, 2022 - Moved into new computer, noticed issues, began self-troubleshooting. ⦁	A significant amount of time was spent attempting to troubleshoot the issue on my own before reaching out for support. This included checking for system updates, testing multiple versions of hardware support software, investigating error logs, ruling out internet issues, etc. ⦁	July 22, 2022 - Contacted CLX support. ⦁	July 22 - 29, 2022 - Went back and forth with CLX and it was agreed that CLX would send a replacement GPU with a hold charge until the original was returned.  ⦁	August 8, 2022 - I received and installed the replacement GPU.  ⦁	August 10, 2022 - Contacted CLX about the previously reported issues not being resolved.  ⦁	August 10 - December 3, 2022 - Went through multiple CLX support representatives and various redundant methods of troubleshooting with no positive result. I also did a clean install of windows on a brand new SSD.  ⦁	December 6, 2022 - CLX representative (with my full case details in front of him) stated in writing that, due to constant issues throughout my ownership of the system, they could offer either a full refund and waived restocking fee upon return of the system or a full system replacement. ⦁	December 7, 2022 - I responded that I would like to proceed with receiving a full refund upon return of the system. ⦁	December 10, 2022 - The CLX representative went back on his offer.

Review.Titre: Ordered a $5k gaming desktop and received a $1k desktop in the box.
Review.Contenu: I ordered the CLX TGMSETRTH0B19BR at Best Buy for pickup on 10/31/2021. It arrived on time on 11/12/2021. Excited to try out my new gaming desktop I went home and started to unpack it. I even recorded videos of me opening it up because I wanted to create an unboxing video for the PC. I was met with complete disappointment as soon as I opened the box and removed the packaging at the top. It was the wrong PC. To start off, the one I ordered was BLACK. The one I received was in a small WHITE case. The one I ordered was supposed to have a Nvidia 3090 graphics card and the small white case in front of me would not be an appropriate case for that graphics card. Also to no surprise, it was not the 3090 graphics card inside the case. The one I ordered was supposed to have a AMD Ryzen 9 5900X, the one I received had an Intel processor inside. The PC I ordered is marketed as having two USB 3.0 and eight USB 3.2 ports. The PC I received had two clearly labeled USB 2.0 ports at the top of the case. I didn’t bother checking the rest of the ports past that point. It was absolutely clear in less than a minute that I had received a PC that would be worth around a thousand dollar when I ordered a PC whose regular price is $5,629.99. I checked the packaging and the manufacturer sticker Model number and the UPC matched the PC I had actually ordered. I’m not sure how a mistake like this occurs; they labeled it correctly but shipped a completely different PC in the box. I went back to my local Best Buy and they were nice enough to take it back and order me another one. However, now I have to wait until 12/03/2021 to receive it. That is an additional 3 weeks before I hopefully receive the correct PC. The PC I received was such a lower tier than the PC I had ordered that I could not entertain actually keeping it and using it. This was my first time ordering a PC from CLX and this was the most disappointing experience as a buyer that I have ever had. I really am hoping that they at least ship me the correct PC this time but for a mistake such as that to happen that will cost me an additional three weeks without a PC is unacceptable when paying for such an expensive piece of hardware.

Review.Titre: CLX: A company that doesn't stand by it's quality assurance statement
Review.Contenu: I was excited when I bought my $2600 customized computer from CLX. When it arrived on 3/2, I added two 16 mb RAM sticks with the 2 RAM 16 mbs sticks that came with the computer because CLX ( I called CLX two times on 3/3 to confirm before doing it Chase, said I could do that ( 4 x 16 Kingston Fury Beast RAM in an ASUS motherboard x670E- plus designed to hold 128 mbs of RAM. I used the computer that night to set it up, turned it off and went to bed.  I tried to turn it on the next morning (3/4) the lights came on and it wouldn't start. After doing research, I swapped the RAM sticks around, then took 3 RAM sticks out; and it started after several attempts. I had to use one RAM 16 mbs 6000mhz stick and set it at 3600mhz. The Ryzen 9 7900 worked fine all the time, the ASUS motherboard was faulty. On 3/4, I contacted CLX tech support and spoke with Brandon who seemed helpful at first. We discussed options and I followed his recommendations of replacing the ASUS motherboard with an MSI motherboard and using 2 sticks of 32 x 2 6000mhz RAM instead of 4 x16 6000mhz RAM. (Brandon told me via email) 4 sticks of DDR5 RAM may be problematic with ASUS or/and Ryzen systems. He said MSI motherboard is better.However, Brandon wanted me to partially pay for the MSI motherboard (then waived it after I brought it up). On 3/7 Brandon offset after receiving my response on 3/5 by saying I have to pay for 32x2 RAM sticks and I can keep the 2 x16 sticks I paid for if the RMA team could not get the computer to work with 4 sticks of RAM (Brandon recommended earlier on 3/4/23 motherboard replacement and 32x2 sticks of RAM the day before and said nothing about me paying for the RAM sticks). Additionally, CLX was going to pay for shipping, but when I wanted a refund after Brandon kept changing options on 3/6, I received an email from Brandon saying I will be charged a 15% restocking fee and shipping ($525.00). At 7:11 pm on 3/6,  I spoke with Omar and I asked to speak with a manager. He put me on hold, he spoke with a manager (but wouldn't let me talk with the manager). Omar, said the manager waived my 15% restocking fee and my initial shipping fee is part of the refund, however, I have to pay to ship the item back.What could have CLX done better:1. Teach tech support and support people better consumer service; a happy customer tell others which brings more business. 2. When a customer requests to speak to a manager that should've happened. Never deflect! Managers are paid to solve problems, not avoid them. Omar did not want to help me, he wanted to get me off the phone and not let me speak with a manager.3. If it is in CLX customizable computer column and it doesn't work; STAND by your product and fix it...(Quality assurance is just as important as making a sale); even if CLX have to upgrade one item free of charge. Unpleasant Customer experiences reduce consumer confidence in the product purchased. Trying to get a customer to pay more money after having bad experiences with a product, is like pouring salt into the wound.4. Customers realize things happen, the true measure of a company should be to  demonstrate how to solve it, especially when the customer wanted to keep the computer.5. Listen to solve, not to defend. 6. Be honest and candid, it builds consumer confidence. 7. Customers like me want something that work, not try to get something for nothing. If it was my fault,  I would gladly pay. My computer built by CLX did not last one day; installing 2 sticks of 16 6000mhz RAM doesn't break a computer (or not supposed). I had a warranty that covered parts and labor and CLX still tried to make me pay some money to fix my computer after agreeing it maybe be capability issues that is causing my computer problems. CLX customizable sections when I built my computer stated no conflicts. All I wanted was my computer fixed and I didn't get that; so I reluctantly returned it for a full refund.

Review.Titre: This company is a complete joke
Review.Contenu: This company is a complete joke.  I have not been able to use the computer I purchased through their brand, CLX Gaming for $7000 on November 4th. Here is a timeline of events that have occurred since ordering this computer:1. Computer was received on November 16, 2020. When booting up, I discovered that it would not go through the windows setup process and froze up. I tried reinstalling from numerous USB devices, it still would freeze. I replaced the M.2 ssd to see if that worked, same results. I tried installing linux on it just to see if it was a windows issue, same results.2. After troubleshooting, I sent it back on RMA3. It was supposedly repaired and sent back to me. Upon receipt, the video card was not working and was artifacting. I reached out again, this time I was told the video card was shot and their tech support lead offered to send out a replacement. December 14th,  I received the replacement and put the card in. I booted up the machine and found that not only was the problem I sent in the PC for not repaired, but Windows was instead installed on my storage SSD and the M2 problem was ignored.4. I reach out to their tech support lead frustrated on the 15th. 4 days later I get a reply that they are RMA'ing my computer again to fix the issue. December 21, the computer is picked up by UPS for repair, I am told it will be max 1 week. Instead of using next day UPS shipping, the computer takes forever and arrives at their facility on December 28th.5. After numerous emails, I get no replies with status updates. On January 4th, I finally get a reply back from their tech support lead telling me that they've basically done everything and can't figure out what the problem is. I reply back asking for a refund or a brand new machine to be built so I can get working.6. January 7th, still not received a reply. Every time I email, I have to wait 2-4 days for a reply. I send a note to their management and back to their tech support lead telling them im done and have filed with my credit card company. I tell them to refund me and not ship back the broken computer. 1 hour later and still with no replies to me, they ship it back anyways.This is how they treat their customers. They build garbage that isn't tested and doesn't work and then ignore you when you have a problem.

I had to RMA a defective GPU upon arrival. I know it's not the fault of CLX, but this goes against receiving their PC's in optimal condition. The process was quick enough but soon realized had I not made a call the delay in processing my GPU would've been longer. While customer service has been good, it is not the best. Had this not been the case, regardless of the RMA, this leaves a mark down 1 star.Update: This was a 4 star review but I am now required to give this a 1 star review. I am not a happy customer. The above circumstances can be made understandable and unforeseen. However, after multiple emails and directly contacting CLX Support, it is now 10/22/2022 and I have yet to receive my replacement GPU. When called, I was informed that my package was to be priority mail twice. After a follow up I was informed from a CLX representative that continued delay was due to their negligence in processing the shipment. They had their RMA part received on 10/8/2022, why is there a continued hold up at this point if it was sent on priority? I have paid this PC in full and should have expected better customer support than this. I will not be doing continued business with CLX in the future if this is what I have to go through. I hate this, as the guys at CLX seem like nice guys but this is just unacceptable. Glad others can be happy with the PC they got, but if you have to go through their support be prepared for a headache.

Review.Titre: My computer shipped a week after it was…
Review.Contenu: My computer shipped a week after it was supposed to ship. Then ups delayed and extra day which led them to attempt delivery on a day I was not home. So then a week and a half after the original date it was supposed to be delivered it showed up and windows would not load so 4 days later it came in the mail with no key code. I spoke with IT who said he would email me the key code the following day Friday. Never got the email called customer service for about the 6th or 7th time they said they didn’t have any notes of my previous conversation and no pass key was generated. No one will be available to after the weekend to get my pass key. So now A month later I have to wait and see if I finally get my pass key on Monday to finally activate my Windows. O and the reason I got this computer was for my sons birthday which because of the delays did not come on his birthday and when it did finally come it’s sitting in his room now almost 2 weeks with out him being able to fully use it! I have to say it’s been extremely disappointing experience that I would not recommend for anyone

I received my computer and purchased an AIO CPU cooler and 3 additional fans. The case comes with 3 fans, the AIO system comes with 2 and I bought 3 more. For some reason whomever assembled my system, removed the OEM RGB fans from the AIO cooler and replaced them with the additional fans that I bought and CLX Kept the OEM ones. Why would they remove Fans from an Item I bought? So I received my system with only 4 fans total when The case is RGB ready with lights and should be able to change modes and lighting colors but this does not work either. I was told they will be sending me out 2 fans to replace the OEM ones but not sure if they will be the original ones or not. I was told that I can have a computer store tech install the fans when they arrive but I would have to cover the costs? If I wanted to or knew how to build a PC on my own, I would have bought all the parts separate and saved myself about $600.00. So, I am a very unhappy customer what spent almost $2900.00 on a PC from CLX and now I have to work on it myself of pay someone to get it the way I want? 9-2-2022, CLX has offered to have the system sent back to them and have another one made. Once all is done, I will update this review.
Lied to and didn't receive the correct parts

Review.Titre: PLEASE DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY WITH CLX GAMING!
Review.Contenu: I do not even know where to start with this review. If I could give no stars, I absolutely would. I’ve had issue after issue since I bought my customized gaming pc. Spent over $3800 for the build that I’ve at this time had to get parts replaced 3 times since last June 2021. I bought my pc May 27, 2021. I finally received it June 24, 2021. I paid an additional price to have my gaming pc shipped in a crate, which was charged for but not delivered with my pc, so I was upset from the beginning. I proceeded to unpack the pc to find multiple customizations that were replaced by with parts I did not ask for. Parts changed included 3 Red CPU fans (replaced by rainbow colored rbg fans), mousepad and a keyboard . When I called CLX Gaming customer service, I was told the items were replaced because the items I ordered were not in stock. After questioning the representative of why I was not notified of these changes, I could get no clear answer. Basically the items were replaced by whatever they had in stock at the time of build. That was the first issue.After downloading a few games, I noticed studdering during gameplay, I called technical support for help. The technical support agent was able to use Remote Desktop to run a couple tests on the pc. At that time, I found out there was an issue with the 2080TI graphics card. I was told, the graphics card was possibly damaged during shipping and was requested to remove graphics card and ship back to CLX at no charge to me. This is exactly why I paid for it to be shipped in a crate and it was not! I was even upgraded to a 3080 graphics card for the inconvenience which I was happy about, but had no idea of the domino effect that was about to happen. I removed the 2080TI graphics card and shipped it back to CLX.After several weeks, I received the new 3090 graphics card. However, now the issue was that the 3080 was bigger than the previous graphics card (even though the agent knew the build I had), so I had to remove the Sound BlasterX AE-5 Plus-Hi-res PCI-e Gaming Sound Card in order for the 3080 graphics card to fit inside the build. Shipped the sound card back for a refund. Fast forward about 3-4 months, there was a storm that had a power surge and my pc would power up and fans would run, but no signal was being sent to the monitor. I contacted technical support, the agent talked me through a few test and again, suggested that the power surge may have damaged the 3080 graphics card. Since the parts are under warranty, it was suggested to send the entire pc back to CLX for diagnostic testing and repair. After a week or so, received a email that the pc was repaired and tested and working fine.I received the pc back in a couple of weeks. Once received, unpacking and connecting the pc, I noticed that the graphics card was replaced by a totally different 3080 graphics card and not the one that was sent back with the build. Not only was it replaced, but it was a downgrade from what previously I had. When I addressed this with customer service, I was told the card I had was not in stock and would not be in stock for a couple months. So I had to make the choice of keeping the downgraded graphics card or wait about 2 months for the a replacement of the exact one that I previously had. I didn’t want to wait so I just dealt with it. I felt like I had been through enough with the back and forth. Sending parts and the entire pc back in forth became super frustrating and time consuming. This has been a terrible experience for me all around. I spent over $3800 on this custom gaming pc with quality parts and it feels like I purchased a piece of junk! A complete waste. I’ve had more disappointments than pleasurable moments with this pc. And now that my one year warranty is up, I’m sure this will not be a walk in the park with CLX doing anything about it. I WOULD NEVER RECOMMEND this company to ANYONE!!! Customer service was a nightmare, no one calls to ask or tell you anything when they’re building or repairing your pc. It’s unacceptable. It’s too much money being spent for CLX to make decisions on replacements and repairs based off what equipment they have in their warehouse. Not even the courtesy call to let their customers know exactly what is being done with their pc. DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY! This company has to be using refurbished parts and claiming that they’re brand new. Please DON’T WASTE YOUR MONEY!!! Too many issues within a year of buying this pc. After spending $3800+ on a pc, you should not have these type of issues!

They claimed they required an ID check to process my payment, which I’ve never had happen before, and they required me to use an AI site with a sketchy privacy policy to verify my ID. It all seemed very sketchy, so I didn’t go through with my purchase.

Review.Titre: Computer good, chassis has several significant issues.
Review.Contenu: The computer itself works great.  The chassis that the computer is in has multiple dead ports.  Ports on top of the chassis do not work (USB, audio).  The audio ports on the back also do not work.  We were only able to get sound working by connecting a usb headphone set.  Is there any way this can be rectified?

Review.Titre: No working build nearly 2 months later
Review.Contenu: At present, I still do not have a working build.  There were video issues right out of the box.  The video card was returned via RMA and a replacement sent, but it was the wrong card.  This, too was returned and replaced with the correct card, but upon installing, the video issues persisted.  The entire machine was returned last week and, at present, I am waiting to have it diagnosed and repaired.  The result being that nearly two months after paying for this, I don't yet have anything to show for it.  I will say that the support techs have been helpful and communicative throughout this process, which is the reason I've given two stars for the experience instead of one.

Purchased a prebuilt computer for gaming. The first one arrived on time in a great shipping container, but the computer was a dud. The customer service was great so I figured I would try again. The next one they sent me took 2 weeks to get and it worked great. When I wanted to upgrade to more RAM and a new fan again customer service was great, but that is where that great experience ended. They assured me that by paying for overnight shipping I would get it in 2 days it took a week and multiple calls to even get shipping info. Then they required a signature for the items so I had to miss work no problem, but when I opened the box I knew they never listened or looked at my last purchase the fan was artic white when I asked multiple times for a black fan. I called customer service and was asking them to assist me in putting together a 350.00 white fan and the person on the other end told me I really didn't need a new fan my old one would work fine to cool my new set up... THEN called back and they told me I would need it. What is really going on over there? It's a great computer and customer service was good but they really dropped a few pegs in my estimation. Will not do business with them or recommend them to anyone.

Review.Titre: Not bad but could be better

Review.Titre: No display. Display fixed. Now no wifi.
Review.Contenu: Pros- customizing my build was really easy, the computer was packed and shipped well, the system looked clean, tech support has been responsive and helpful. Cons- my monitor won't display. I've had to spend the last 2 days teaching myself about computer builds and hardware installation and troubleshooting because the VGA light on my motherboard is on and i have no display. Had to figure out what bios was, how to check to see if it needed updating, how to update without a monitor, reseat the graphics card, open my older computer to remove that card, test different configurations, trying to figure out why I have no display with my GPU. Can't test another PCIE slot with the AMD Radeon because the GPU support bracket was overtightened and the screw was stripped. Integrated graphics works fine, but since I paid extra for the AMD Radeon, I want that to work. And i wanted a computer that worked out of the box since I really don't have the time to learn how to build and troubleshoot a computer, but oh well. I'm sure once (if?) I get it working, it'll be great.Update 2/11/23- Got my computer back, visuals work great now. Except now my wifi card is missing. For $3k, I sort of expected to have a working machine over 6 weeks after I purchased it. I know things happen, people make mistakes, but still.Update 2/18/23- just realized the original box of accessories with all the extra screws, cables, brackets, and manuals was not returned with my computer. And my wifi card still hasn't shipped. No offers to reimburse me for the literal hours I spent troubleshooting or the hassle of contacting them over and over due to things their QC team should have caught. Never again.
My video card came damaged. I never got a chance to use it before it began crashing. Now I’m paying for a computer that I still have to get fixed.

Support was extremely helpful through the process, but man, everything else.I selected CLX because the price was fair compared to some competitors and because the production time estimate was low; I had a computer with a dying graphics card, and I needed a replacement fast.Production was initially delayed about ten days with no explanation given. I wasn't too worried at first. But then another 15 days passed beyond that estimate with no word at all, with my computer's status as "testing."I emailed to see what was up. I received a response that support would check on the status, with no more updates beyond that - but to their credit, the status of the computer changed to "shipping" about two days later. I think the machine just got lost in the shuffle. I was excited for about 15 minutes, until I read on the shipping QA sheet that there was "no graphics card on sale order," and no graphics card installed.Well. GPU availability is the only reason I tried this system integrator nonsense in the first place, so I was pretty sure that I had a 3080 on the sales order. Emailed right away, on a Thursday; support heroically got the GPU overnighted to me on the following Monday. It arrived the day after the PC. That problem was solved.By the time the GPU arrived, I'd discovered another problem. I had received the computer, unpacked it, and found that... the computer was missing all of the modular power supply's cables, except for the ones plugged into the motherboard and the fans. It was missing the cable for the GPU that never got installed, and other hard drive/PCI power cables besides. No motherboard documentation, no extra motherboard pieces like mounting screws or sata cables, just the singular power cable that goes to the wall.Emailed back again. Support said they'd send those out. Five days later, I haven't received that package or any tracking info, but I have already received some replacements that I ordered from Cablemod. The cable management was nice, except that I had to redo it myself due to the missing graphics card and missing cables. The system is put together competently, except for the bowed side panel from a misaligned clip. The case arrived in good condition, except for one of the side panel thumb screws bent out of place. I am really happy to have my computer, but I am not at all happy with CLX. Support corrected most mistakes quickly, but boy are some of these mistakes embarrassing. If I can help it, I will never purchase from a system integrator again, and I will certainly never purchase from CLX or Cybertron again.

I purchased 2 new custom systems average price for each was around $5,000.  I received the new systems and was surprised and very disappointed when I found that CLX decided to put some very low end, non-programmable keyboards and mice with their $5,000 computers.  I reached out to them and they had a typical corporate response oh I'll let management know, have a good day.  When you spend this kind of money on a custom system you would expect to get higher end IO devices since that is what you use, touch, feel and see the most.  Very disappointed.

New to PC gaming and ultimately chose CLX based on reviews and their easy-to-use custom build userface on their website. The ordering process was great. I received an email every step of the build process. Once the PC was built, tested, and passed through their quality control, I received an email that the PC was ready to ship and was even sent a UPS link to track my shipment. The link said it was scheduled to be delivered within 4 business days. Almost a week later I still had not received the PC. I checked the tracking number and saw that it had never been shipped out. I called customer service and was told it was sitting in the warehouse. No explanation as to why it had not been shipped and no apology for the inconvenience. This would have been a one star review had the ordering process not have been so great. I don't know if I will ever order from CLX again, but if I do I will definitely call earlier to make sure they shipped my order.

Review.Titre: I got given a deferent Ai0 than the one I paid for

some disconnected cables and shipping problems delayed a very long awaited pc

Review.Titre: If I had to do it again
Review.Contenu: If I had to do it again, I would build my own PC. Everything was going great; getting updates daily regarding the build, customer service was helpful with educating me, etc… before I go in to the full story I wanted to give an honorable mention to both Noah and Dimitri for their EXCELLENT customer service and hospitality; great employees. I first ordered my PC on 9/9/22. As mentioned everything was going smoothly and I ended up receiving my PC on the 22nd. I downloaded my games and started playing and the I received a notification that my AMD graphics card was outdated. I clicked update and it needed to restart my PC. After doing so, my monitors read “Input not received”. Keep in mind, I had been playing games for about 5 hours prior to this issue with no problems. I called technical support and we went through various troubleshooting but nothing ended up working and I sent the PC back for a replacement since they determined it was something to do with the motherboard/graphics card. At this point I was already upset because I had to send back the PC… Once they got the PC the glass was shattered in shipment so they ended up having to do a full rebuild. I spoke with the returns/replacement team countless times and they got supervisors involved to go ahead and expedite the process so I wouldn’t have to wait another two weeks for the PC to return. I was originally quoted a quick turnaround time of 3 to 4 days. It ended up taking nearly 3 weeks. I just received my PC back yesterday and it did the exact same thing as the first time around… instead of calling them and potentially sending it back and waiting for God knows how long again, I went to Micro Center. At Micro Center they instantly knew what the problem was. The BIOS was 1.5 YEAR OLD. The graphics card my PC is running wasn’t even out at that time!! Once they updated the BIOS I came home and plugged it in and have had 0 problems since. I’m very disappointed that proper testing wasn’t done not once but twice before being shipped out to me. I can only imagine, I’m not the only one that has experienced this with CLX. All I received in return for this hassle was very surface level “sorry for the inconvenience l, sir”. In my experience, CLX does not value their customers.

Review.Titre: I love the PC but it did not come with…
Review.Contenu: I love the PC but it did not come with Windows 11 on it so i had to put it on the PC myself. And to this day it is telling me to Activate Windows it should have came out the box with the Windows 11 on it.

Review.Titre: A custom pc builder that you roll the dice on
Review.Contenu: I’m giving this review 3 stars because technically it’s not complete. I ordered one of their pcs about a month ago which costs about $5K with all of the high end components installed. I received my system within 3 weeks which is reasonable as far as wait time goes. When I powered on the pc for the first time, I was very excited to start gaming and within 10 minutes I received a blue screen of death without any programs or heavy load running. At first I thought maybe the system just needs to warm up a bit after being in a crate for a week. I then experienced blue screens left and right including during web browsing. I contacted customer service and they said it was likely a memory issue with the RAM sticks and that I needed to download a memory test on a usb and diagnose the problem myself to be sure, which I thought that’s what they were supposed to do before shipping it out to me but whatever. I ran the test and found out both RAM sticks were corrupted which shocked me because I haven’t been in possession of the system for more than a week. Luckily they were able to swap out the sticks for new ones once I shipped the defective sticks back to them and they paid for shipping both ways which was nice. After waiting for nearly two weeks, the new RAM sticks finally arrived and I installed them. I was still getting blue screens even with the new sticks installed and I contacted customer service again and they claimed it might be a problem with the memory controller of either the CPU or the motherboard itself and that I had to box up the system and send it back to them for repair which I ended up doing. I’ve had nothing but problems with this pc ever since I received it and now I have to wait even longer for me to use it, let alone enjoy it. I understand that some things are out of their control when they ship it, but it’s almost like they’re using second hand parts in mine. They should have caught all of this during testing, but it doesn’t look like they tested it very muchOverall, buying from them is a gamble in my experience. I’ll see what happens once I receive the system back, but I’m not very impressed with everything so far

Excellent computers and fairly easy ordering process.  What was upsetting was that almost immediately after the computer was ordered, I received an email saying that the delivery date would be delayed.  Then I was sent an email requesting a review even though I was nowhere near receiving the product.  Unfortunately, I had to give a 1-star for my experience to-date.  After several more delays the product finally at about twice the quoted time period.

The PC customization experience was fantastic. The options and pricing was great. However after my order was placed, my order was shipped to the wrong address. It took a while to be shipped back to the CLX location. I was offered some compensation for the trouble. Once back at the CLX location I was told that there was an issue regarding another part that needed to be replaced. This took some more time. After all was said and done, it was just under a month until the PC arrived. The PC arrived in exceptional packaging, and was very neat and clean. I set the PC up and attempted to set it up for first time use. The PC would boot to the bios and would not allow me to boot to windows. After some personal troubleshooting j called CLX support and was on the phone for about 2 hours. Which the problem was a loose drive.After all of the issues the PC was set up and finally able to use it. It has been excellent ever since.

Ordering the computer my grandson wanted was the easy part. We appreciated ongoing updates on construction and shipping also. However the  package was lacking the keyboard , mouse and wireless card.  Was there any quality control on final package ? Customer service sent items within a week. Next , my grandson discovered the hard drive was not the terabyte size we ordered. This issue is not resolved yet. The package was put together and shipped very quickly. This efficiency is negated when so much was missing and not built to requested specs.  After this rough start however, he is pleased with machine.

Review.Titre: Good, Not Great In My Opinion
Review.Contenu: The look on my CLX Set is pretty cool.  The build time and time it took to arrive was relatively quickly.  The cost given the performance is what makes me slightly dissatisfied.  I've used it for roughly 2 months now, and after discussing with buddies who know the PC industry, I wish I had gone to them to build me a computer or help me find a good deal on CLX or somewhere else.  Overall, CLX isn't bad, but I would go a different direction if I could go back into the past.

Build quality and cable management are great. System was 100% plug and play. However, not installing 3 case fans, then having 2 seperate customer service reps blatantly lie to me prevents me from giving you higher than 3 stars. Your build team is great, your customer service team needs work. Thanks for the beautiful PC, my son loves it.

Review.Titre: Order missing things that I paid fore
Review.Contenu: I ordered a custom build ended up paying 2675.87 pc works fine my problem was I paid extra for the wooden crate shipping pc showed up without it I also ordered a keyboard and mouse they were a no show as well the gpu brace was just loose and rattling around inside the pc I am still waiting for refund on crate I did receive the keyboard and mouse after calling customer service.  I had to install the brace myself

My completion date changed numerous times even though when I checked the status of my order throughout the time there was never any mention about shortage in parts or anything to really explain why the delay. Now that my pc is built. It has sat for over a week with the status of label created yet never actually on its way to me. I would expect that if i order a pc before thanksgiving i would be able to get it before Christmas.

Review.Titre: overall well-built PC, has a few software issues
Review.Contenu: overall well-built PC, lacked any major software [I had to download drivers as it came without for some reason]

Review.Titre: Issues started before I received the…
Review.Contenu: Issues started before I received the PC.  Issue 1 - QA build photo provided during the assembly showed incorrectly installed connectors.  I called customer service, rep verified the issue and said it would be corrected prior to shipment.  First thing I did after receiving the PC was to pull the back cover to verify the fix.  Of course it wasn't done!  I had to remove three of the zip ties to loosen the cables enough to correctly install the 3 connectors.  Issue 2 - Whoever installed the packing material inside mangled the Video card bracket.  Issue 3 - Loose motherboard mounting screw.  Issue 4 - memory speed incorrectly configured in the bios.  Issue 5 - Ordered a keyboard and mouse which didn't arrive with PC, called customer service, we can fix that.  Two weeks later still no keyboard and mouse.  I spent the extra few hundred dollars to buy a custom PC so I could have an "Expert" build it.  Guess I should have just ordered the parts and built it myself.

Review.Titre: I love the overall looks and…
Review.Contenu: I love the overall looks and performance of my computers. But With all the so called inspections both computers have the back panel of the housing installed incorrectly. With all the components installed No instructions were included for those components. I can only give it 3 stars because of the lack of instructions perinstructions. But the overall appearance and performance are great.

Excellent quality PC and incredibly easy to use platform. I knew exactly what I was getting and the PC performs smoothly so far. My only complaint is that one of my PCs (I ordered 3) arrived missing an essential part. Customer service was excellent and had the part sent out immediately, however, I had to install the missing part myself. Not a big deal since I know how to do it, but one of the perks of ordering online and spending 1400 a pop is that I don’t have to do the labor myself. If I had known 1400 bucks wasn’t enough to have my PC properly assembled, I would’ve done it myself from the start. As it stands, the PC is great and is currently functioning as expected. I am pleased with the purchase despite the small bump in the road I experienced.
During the different stages of being built it was being delayed over and over, then at one point i wouldn't  get updates till i emailed.

Review.Titre: Problems with shipping and the inspection
Review.Contenu: The computer works fine where I had the problems was that I paid for a wooden crate for shipping. I did not receive it. I also purchased a keyboard and mouse did not receive that either I contacted CLX they said they were going to refund for the crate and send me, a new mouse and keyboard, I received a mouse and keyboard I have not received the refund for the crate the only other issue I had the stabilization brace for the GPU was rattling around in the PC I had to install that piece myself

Review.Titre: great prebuilt gaming pc with some issues
Review.Contenu: The pc I bought came fully functional and works very well. I'm content overall but there are some bigger issues with my experience. For starters the free game keys had to be chased after to obtain instead of being included in an email or physically in the box when shipped.As well as the cable management in the back of the case being very worrying due to zip ties being tied way to tight to the cable, suffocating them to the point of indentation and making it impossible to switch out or even adjust cables and the power supply without damaging or destroying the cables.Finally one of the pcie cables that was never in use on this pc due to my choice of gpu came partially damaged/melted which is unacceptable in my opinion. I did not pay for damaged or used parts. Every cable, screw, and part should be brand new and quality checked as advertised.For a 2500$ prebuilt I'm satisfied but there are issues that baffled me considering CLX's fantastic reputation.
My machine was unfortunately DOA (POST DRAM failure). However the experience with tech support has been positive so far. Hopefully the issue will be resolved and I can start using the new machine.

Review.Titre: I have not had a computer a month.
Review.Contenu: I have not had the computer a month, and it's already given me complications. Do not look for customer service to be a help as I've already called them and they seem to know nothing about their own product.

In the span of three months my wife and I purchased 2 PCs.  Both PCs where well packaged and seemed to be running okay thus far; however, both had issues.  The PC we purchased for our son had a loose M.2 drive, missing manuals, and case components.  I called CLX and was told the missing items would be shipped to us.  That was nearly a month ago and we still haven't seen them.  The PC I bought her for her Birthday had its manuals, and case components, but was missing USB wifi adapter.  I did not call CLX on this because I figured it would just end up with the items from the last call I made.  All in all, these might seem like minor issues but when you consider the timing of our purchases, both PCs had issues, and missing items were promised but never delivered well it all adds up to one main issue I don't consider minor and that's the lack of good quality control.

i didnt get no power cords or remote to pc

The PC itself works as expected, all parts came with it and a few extra bits and pieces from the case and motherboard. The cable management was pretty good, better than I could do myself so I cannot complain. Now, to start with the shipping, my order got delayed on 3 separate occasions and there “up to the minute” tracking is lackluster at best, if you want info on the order status just call them and they are usually quick to respond. Now the PC itself has 10 RGB fans that do turn on and run through there basic color scheme, but the kicker is, the remotes that they sent with it for the fans do not work, or at least the actual control panel that they are hooked up to does not read the remote. But they work fine and it still looks esthetically pleasing. The 2 16GB sticks of ram I received had multiple scratches on them that become very visible when the RGB is on. But once again they work fine and up to par. Lastly, I ordered a 3080ti for a PREMIUM price, that being said they do not give you the option or ability to see or change which brand you receive of the GPU. But I took the risk and rolled the dice, and wouldn’t you know it, a FE. Which all and all are very clean looking, but does lack a bit in the cooling department. With all that being said the PC runs great. Got everything as promised, but didn’t get the Premium Quality of everything from orderstatus, to actual hardware, but was paying a premium fee. Specs:GPU:3080ti FECPU: Asus ROG Strix Z690eIntel i9 12900kf2x16GB DDR5 OLOy ram1TB Samsung SSD4 TB seagate barracuda HD360mm AIO CLX cooling10 CLX RGB fansLian Li inverted 011 Case

So knew exactly how the process was going and if there where changes to the time of shipping they would let you know immediately.  I ended up getting my pc nearly a whole week earlier than expected.  As of now I've had it for almost 2 months and it's running fine I have no issues with it at all.  With the model I picked I can run some of the best games out there such as Squad, BG3, and more.

Review.Titre: Great packaging, slight display port issue
Review.Contenu: I was impressed with the packaging. Instructions for assembly was good. Machine and equipment all worked great. The package only carried a display port. This came in the monitors packaging, but there was no input on the PC for the display port, only for HDMI, so luckily I had a spare HDMI cable that came with one of my other electronics, I think a Roku, so I was still able to get the machine up and running. So my suggestion is to add a display card that carries this type of port on your other machines.

Review.Titre: The performance is great for the price but…

Also during start up the graphics card fan was making a lot of noise for some reason so I checked and one of the wires was sticking up, luckily it wasn’t damaged. I had to get my friend that builds computers fix all the wires.

Review.Titre: From Really Wrong to Pretty Right
Review.Contenu: They sent me the wrong computer. Yep, I ordered a unit from them for about $1100, a lot of cash for me. I patiently waited as they assembled it and they included pictures and documents showing every step of the process from building to testing. It was all done with enthusiastic professionalism… and then they sent me the wrong computer. The one that was sent to me was a much lesser model than the one I ordered and I didn’t discover it until I had set it up and was installing Windows. That’s why I can’t give CLX 5 stars. What I can say is that I feel that they worked pretty aggressively to correct that mistake. They were very apologetic, always professional in the face of a couple emails that were a bit angry and had the computer that I ordered shipped to me about a week later. If you should choose to do business with CLX, and I heartily recommend that you do, and there’s a problem that you run into, ask for Brad Wilkerson. That dude should be working at the State Department, solving the world’s crises. He knows how to solve a problem and does an amazing job at placating a customer that might not be too happy.

It was really easy getting the part I wanted and I really like that there was a system in place that would tell you if there was a problem with the parts you had. Shipping took a little longer than I expected but when I got it I was happy with the results. I would suggest looking more into the fans cause the ones I got were a little louder than I like them to be. Overall I'm satisfied with my experience with Clxgaming.

I have the pc for some time now. I needed an upgrade even higher a bit specially on graphics. I managed to play on a game with a lower quality to run smooth because on higher it would be laggy a bit. On a different game it runs smooth than my laptop. I really like how its designed with colors with remote control. I liked all colors. Me and my cousin forgot to add Wi-Fi instead it only had ethernet slot but he gave me an Wi-Fi USB adapter, I am also using ethernet cable to run smooth and also Bluetooth isn't working somehow maybe I didn't selected when building my own. I used a headset and only thing I can do is listen to music with it but it can work on pc too since it works on ps4/ps5. I tried the headset on my laptop and it worked fine so maybe the samething, I probably didn't select it on building my own.

Review.Titre: CLX is a decent brand, just do your research as always.

Certainly not the best value for the price, but to save yourself from headaches the prebuilt PCs seem to be great, just make sure you know what you’re getting before buying. My personal experience, this thousand dollar prebuilt I got was exciting until I realized it was 512mb onboard graphics (good for really non-demanding games). For example: I’ve learned I can’t run games like Fortnite, Destiny, R6Siege on low settings. Fortnite was a shocker but hey, I knew all the parts that came with it, just not what all of them meant :/. Not CLX’s fault. Personally feel like a pc starting over 1k SHOULD have better graphics- once again my own mistake.Customer service and their online support chat were both 50/50. One side where they answer and it’s generally both real friendly and helpful, the other side being zero response (especially the online website chat, took too long to get responses there, waited up to 20 minutes before I gave up on it).

Review.Titre: Updated feedback for "I have not had a chance to actually use…"
Review.Contenu: I have not had a chance to actually use the laptop.  When I received it, the number pad did not work (i.e., couldn't type numbers), and the keyboard itself was warped.  I had to return the laptop to CLX for repairs right after receiving it, so I've had to begin payment for a system I have yet to be able to actually use and per the information received from CLX, repairs can take up to 4 weeks.  That said, communication prior to returning the laptop for repairs was great and I'm looking forward to eventually being able to use it.Update:  My laptop was returned to me after approximately 3 weeks of sitting untouched on a repair bench.  The rep I spoke with promptly addressed the issue and the laptop was repaired and shipped back to me, overnight, within 24 hours of contacting the CLX rep.   The issue I returned the laptop for (i.e., defective number pad) was repaired; however, while typing, I found that the "y" key was no longer working.  I contacted CLX about the issue and received a response within 48 hours, with an offer to repair or refund, but shortly after receiving CLX's reply, the "y" key began working, so I decided to not return the laptop, as everything else seemed to be working fine at that point.  Hopefully, those are the only two issues I will have with this laptop.

Review.Titre: Reviews that only focus on the bad suck.
Review.Contenu: I would love to give CLX 5 stars, as there's almost nothing bad I could say about them. My only hangup is this: I had forgotten to add a wireless card to my order upon initially placing my order (that much is my own fault, I'm aware) and called to add one to my order. They were great about placing the order for me, and totally understanding, and assured me that it would arrive with my build.  The problem is, it did not. I did have to call to make it right, and I was without a usable computer until I could get it connected to the internet. To their credit, they did overnight the card to me, which was appreciated.Enough about the bad, let's talk about the good, because there's a lot. Their pc builder system is phenomenal, and after building the same pc on multiple different pc builder sites, I found that CLX had the best pricing of all of them. Ordering my pc was a breeze, and the ability to receive a step by step breakdown of the build process with photos and benchmarks was a nice touch. When I received my computer without the wireless card their staff was incredibly helpful in helping me at least get windows to boot without the internet (in case you were still living in 2008, everything needs the internet these days) which was a blessing. The computer looks and runs beautifully, and if I ever need to buy another computer, I know who I'm ordering it from!

Review.Titre: Good, but not Excellent. B- experience overall.
Review.Contenu: in 2023 I've purchased 2 computers with CLX, one in February for my wife and another in July for myself. They were each bought separately under different user IDs and names, so each time CLX treated me as a new customer. Reason to go with CLX was that overall 2023 GPU choices are awful, and they got 3090s back in stock which I ended up deciding was worth any possible trouble. They don't disclose the brand in the website when you place the order, though. Both of these computers came with ZOTAC 3090s despite the 5 month difference between purchases. Not a terrible GPU, neither a fantastic one. For the price charged, I expected a better model. Both computers are specked differently and for different workloads and uses, including a mix of professional and private leisure/gaming activities. The variety offered by CLX is pretty good for all major items, but it is certainly not exhaustive. You can find better items in all categories if you'd shop around and invest time, but it is hard to beat the convenience and possibilities they offer among all the major SI's and computer brands/boutiques. They do not offer CPU contact frames though, and they do not send a USB system recovery flash drive. Assemble time is far too long, and part of the waiting is due to their internal testing. That would be OK if all computers would leave their production line in perfect state, but that is not the case, so the waiting time in general is not good. My wife's order took a month to be fulfilled, and mine took 15 calendar days. They claim they keep you updated at every step of the way, but that is only true if your order is moving seamlessly among their production line steps. If anything happens at given step that adds delay to the process, you don't proactively hear about it. Once you do reach out to the customer support team, though, they are very responsive. The fact that I can add this statement about customer support responsiveness to my review however shows how many time I've had to contact customer support in the process of buying these 2 computers, and that overall is not that good. The packing of the computer for shipping is flawless. One of the computers we bought came in their wooden cage crate, and the other one in a regular shipping box. Both were excellently packed, with enough protection, foam and wrapping, and arrived undamaged. Neither of the computers was optimized for performance on arrival. Running typical benchmarks showed lower scores than expected, and mostly that was because of poor motherboard settings and adjustments. I'm not talking about overclocking stuff, it's more like adequately adjusted Fan curves and thermal profiles, turning REBAR on etc. XMP was turned on and memory was correctly configured in both computers, so that is a plus when confronted against the majority of the other SIs and computer manufacturers. My computer in particular arrived with all fans in max speed setting with a flat curve of 100% performance at any CPU temperature, producing unbearable noise even when idling. REBAR was off. Motherboard management software was not installed. I like the "no bloat policy" they have, but I do think that motherboard management software should be included and the computer fine tuned for performance given how many extra days they retain it "in testing"  before shipping it out. On top of it, the motherboard manual was not included among the physical items they shipped to me, which is another failure of their check SOP. They have one final check step before the computer is packed for shipping just to ensure all relevant items and accessories are included (they include that in a report which you can download from their website), and still missed the motherboard manual. Their testing process overall adds 3 business days to ensure everything is good, and I still got a computer poorly configured and with a missing manual, so what good is the delay in shipping because of testing if you still have to put a lot of work when the computer arrives before you can really start using it? Build quality is overall very good, including cable management. After 2 computer purchases, I can't say I have become a die-hard loyal fan. I've had computers from Dell, NZXT, Lenovo and ACER. CLX was the first high-end boutique I decided to purchase from, and overall I think they do a good job, but not an excellent one. I was hoping for an A- experience, but think a fair rate would be B-. There is room for improvement, and you will get a good computer in the end. If you know how to fine tune and adjust it afterwards, you should be in good shape. I will consider them as a viable option again in the future, but will also shop around for both price and inventory before committing to buying from them again.

Review.Titre: OK, but not great and not worth the price UPDATED
Review.Contenu: While I am mostly happy with my order after getting it, the actual order process was not without snags and annoyances. I expected more when paying so much. My order sat in the "parts picking" phase for 11 days before I got fed up and inquired about the hold-up. No parts were back-ordered, so this should not have happened. I was given a canned, weak response and excuse about parts availability. I tried to be understanding, but felt some compensation was due as this was obviously an order that "fell through the cracks". I asked if they would give me a complimentary upgrade valued at a paltry $100 to make me happy again about my $5500 order. They refused, which was further infuriating.They also failed to let me pick my GPU brand, nor gave any notice on their website that the brand you get can vary and will be chosen by them. That is poor communication and feels scammy. Other sites clearly note this for their customers. I was not happy with the order process, the lack of communication with the customer, the lack of any desire to make my grievance right, and their exceptionally high prices which did not translate to a better experience in my case. The only thing I was happy with was the shipping. The shipping team did an excellent job in getting my system packed and sent safely and securely. I am also happy with the performance of the rig I received, but I credit that more to the parts I picked and the price I paid rather than anything CLX did.All in all, I could have gotten the same system for far less cost elsewhere and would probably have had a better experience, which is incredibly disappointing. I doubt I will be a returning customer for CLX and will likely take my business elsewhere in the future. This outcome is not at all what I was expecting and is deeply disappointing, again considering the price of my purchase. I expected a seamless process and did not get that at all. Compounding the problem was CLX customer service refusing to do even a tiny thing to make this right. Too bad, I really wanted to love this company.UPDATE: After posting this review, CLX contacted me to follow up on the problems with my order. Joshua did an excellent job of explaining things to me regarding my order. More importantly, he tried to make it right by offering me a few options. I was allowed to choose from an upgrade in parts or a small refund. These terms were acceptable to me, but more importantly, it was huge to receive a call from them. It shows they do care and that is invaluable. Fair is fair and I am happy to update my review as a result. 2 stars to 4 stars. This one phone call by Joshua salvaged a wrecked relationship and I will once again consider CLX for my future needs. All companies take note: This is a lesson in how quickly and easily good customer service can bring a customer back from the brink. And how quickly and easily bad customer service can wreck a business. Thanks for your help Joshua, and for caring. Much appreciated.

I have waited to give my review until some time has passed and a problem taken care of. I bought the pre-built computer, ordering it was simple and painless. A tracking number was promptly sent. I received it on time and packaged very well.The computer was, as advertised and performed / met my expectations.  The problem arose after having the computer a week. The problem was extremely high temps and would not go down even though it was idle for over an hour.  I called customer support and was pleasantly surprised with a very knowledgeable, pleasant, English speaking, understandable young man who walked me through a fix.  A+ CLX on that one….. The problem was the fan placement on the motherboard.  That same young man walked me through moving the fan header to a different spot and the problem was solved.A second problem arrived.   I looked in bios to see if there was a problem with the header that went bad.  I noticed bios was not registering any of the 6 installed fans.  I called customer service and talked to a different young man.  Again this person was again top notch.  He concluded the fan control module was bad and sent me a new one.  I installed that part. LGB lighting works, fans work problem fixed.  Is the motherboard going to fail elsewhere? I wanted to send the whole unit back to be fixed or gone though. This is where CLX you get a D. Four weeks turn around to send a computer in to be fixed that is only a week old is a big fail on your end.  I would have even been happy with send this one in and when received you sent a new one back.  I was told that was not an option. In conclusion my review is I had a good experience buying and receiving the pc. Customer service was top notch and painless. Currently I am waiting for the motherboard to implode???? Will I buy again or recommend a CLX computer? Not sure there. I am not happy with CLX unwilling to go over this computer in a timely manner and assure me that the mother board will be ok in the long run.Sincerely James Cameron

Review.Titre: CLX made my purchase experience a joy!
Review.Contenu: CLX made my purchase experience a joy! Their web site makes it easy to configure a system with all the latest improvements and once ordered, they continuously provide email  updates on building, configuring, testing, quality control, and shipping and even include photos and quality sign-offs on each step of the construction and testing of the system with the highlighted components!  And, to my surprise, the system was shipped and arrived much earlier than the promised date!  Fast, efficient, thorough, Customer friendly and painless!  Great purchase experience!  Thank You All!

Review.Contenu: The product worked beautifully out of the box, and the tech support team was very quickly able to diagnose underperformance in other purchased hardware. First-time customer who’s thrilled with the level of service and quality of product. Thank you. :)

Customer service/support has been above and beyond. Really helpful and really go out of their way to help. I can’t say enough good things about this company and have recommended them to multi people.

Review.Titre: prompt assistance and very solid system
Review.Contenu: Being ignorant about the size requirement for an Asus RTX 4090 card, I purchased a computer from Clxgaming. Clxgaming helped me with it and I managed to order another one that works well with the card.

The new CLX clmputer arrived in a very secure wooden crate.  Very beefy!  The computer was immaculate and unharmed within.After unpacking (and removing the foam inside the computer -- very important!) and connecting it to my existing three monitors and flight simulation hardware, I was met with a very easy transition to the new CLX computer.The CLX computer is a dream in terms of performance.  The RTX-4090 graphics card is able to keep up with Microsoft Flight Simulator configured at the very highest display resolution.  The Intel I9-13900K processor cuts through every computing challenge like a hot knife through butter, and the installed 64GB RAM handles anything with plenty of room left over.Awesome machine and highly reccommend CLX.

I recently bought a pc, with a little bit of experience. Their website is amazing, because of how user friendly it is. They give you a detailed description on every part they have available to suit you best. Not only is their website fantastic but also the service. The outstanding workers were able to get the pc put together and shipped in a couple of days. I received it within the week of clicking buy. I HIGHLY recommend CLX. Thanks you and keep up the great work!!

This was the 2nd pc ordered and the options for order are vast and priced better than othere that I could find.Time to complete the build was faster than before as well with the same quality as before.Exceeded Expectations!!!!
